Threads.net now supports the #indieWeb #microformats #openStandard rel-me for distributed âœ… verification!Â¹ (supported since 2023-08-09)
My Threads profile already had my domain since it was created from my Instagram profile.
View source on https://www.threads.net/@tantek and you can see the #relMe on a link tag:
Â <link rel="me" href="https://tantek.com/" />
Instructions to add yours:
* Add your domain to your Threads profile "Link" field. Thatâ€™s it.
Longer explicit steps: https://indieweb.org/rel-me#Threads
Thanks especially to @timothychambers.net (@tchambers@indieweb.social, Â @timothyjchambers@threads.net) for requesting rel-me supportÂ² which one Threads engineer â€œdecided to hack it togetherâ€ one night!Â³
You can view Timâ€™s profile @tchambers@indieweb.social for a real world example of a Mastodon profile showing a green text âœ… verified link to a Threads profile.
Tim made several good points in his request:
â€œâ€¦ a small, but disproportionately helpful addition would be to support this "rel=me" feature in your profiles. That could launch well before full ActivityPub, & show the first real integration to open social web standardsâ€
Microformats (and IndieWeb) standards in general are deliberately designed as small, incremental building blocks which are disproportionately helpful as Tim says.
These small building blocks which directly enable user features are usually something a web developer can code at least some (often complete!) support for in one day/night which makes them particularly appealing as a way to rapidly support open #socialWeb standards used by the #fediverse and beyond.
Incrementally implementing microformats & IndieWeb standardsâ´ also demonstrates good will and good intentions for supporting the #openWeb.
This is day 44 of #100DaysOfIndieWeb. #100Days
â† Day 43: https://tantek.com/2023/171/t1/anniversaries-microformats-posse

June #trailRunner #ultraRunner weekends
3 finished #MUC50k @InsideTrail #RodeoBeach 9:38:28, my 3rd #50k #ultraMarathon #trailRace
11 volunteered @TheDipsea #DipseaRace at #MuirWoods
18 finished @BrokenArrowCA #BA23k 5:22:54 #RingDasBell, my 1st #skyRace
24-25 crewed pal @davidtlam @wser.org 100mi to a successful #WS100 finish!
#runner #running #trailRunning
Heart & mind full, body pushed to its limits, capturing my experiences in a few write-ups.

Two anniversaries today: microformats (18y) and POSSE (11y).
Happy 18 years of https://microformats.org/ #microformats!
Most prominent this past year (again) has been the littlest #microformat that could:
rel=me â€” AKA #relMe, now effectively the standard for #distributed #verification on the web:
* https://microformats.org/wiki/rel-me (originally introduced in 2004Â¹)
with support added in the past year for:
* #GitHub multiple rel-me linksÂ²
* #Wikipedia User page rel-me linkÂ³
#POSSE, short for â€œPublish (on your) Own Site, Syndicate Elsewhereâ€, as a term of use is now 11 years oldÂ³, which is surprising since when it was conceived, the #IndieWeb community was in a period of very rapid innovation & iteration.
POSSE itself replaced a previous term, "POSE", short for â€œPublish Once Syndicate Everywhereâ€, which had only been around a year or two at most (Iâ€™m still looking for the first use of the "POSE" abbreviation for that meaning).
Since â€œpublish onceâ€ was vague enough to include practices of publishing once on a social media silo, or in someone elseâ€™s garageâµ, we needed to clearly express the requirement to use your own site instead, first, as the source of your truth. Cross-posting to other sites & channels, is a second, optional step, ideally with a permalink linking back to your original post so viewers can easily discover and use your site.
That distinction was enough for POSSE to express a strong creator-owned-first publishing model that resonated and grew. Every time a silo shutdownâ¶ at the end of its incredible journeyâ·, removing posts & permalinks from the web, POSSE was there for people who were tired of losing their data, permalinks, & profiles, and wanted an alternative.
This is day 43 of #100DaysOfIndieWeb. #100Days
â† Day 42: https://tantek.com/2023/160/t1/mastodon-activitypub-follow-form-bridgy-fed
â†’ Day 44: https://tantek.com/2023/234/t1/threads-supports-indieweb-rel-me

permalink

POSE

Â https://indieweb.org/POSSE
silo
Â https://indieweb.org/silo

Â¹ https://gmpg.org/xfn/11#me
Â² https://tantek.com/2023/032/t1/years-relmeauth-replace-openid
Â³ https://tantek.com/2023/139/t1/wikipedia-supports-indieweb-rel-me

âµ https://tantek.com/2023/001/t1/own-your-notes

â· https://ourincrediblejourney.tumblr.com/

If you added a #Mastodon / #ActivityPub follow form to your #IndieWeb site based on Bridgy Fed (e.g. using code/instructions I previously postedÂ¹), you need to update it to add another invisible input element for the "protocol", e.g.: Otherwise people trying to use your form to follow you may see an error from #BridgyFed like: > Bad Request > Missing required parameter protocol Here is the complete example that I posted previously with the new invisible input:
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â 
I also updated that previous postÂ¹ with the new input in case people find that instead. This is day 42 of #100DaysOfIndieWeb. #100Days â† Day 41: https://tantek.com/2023/139/t1/wikipedia-supports-indieweb-rel-me â†’ Day 43: https://tantek.com/2023/171/t1/anniversaries-microformats-posse Â¹ https://tantek.com/2023/020/t2/bridgy-fed-follow-form

Ran my 11th #BayToBreakers in 1:47:11 on Sunday 2023-05-21, again the day after an @sfrunco.com (@SFRunCo) Saturday trail #run, but this time in the middle of a very long training run, my last before the rescheduled #MUC50k trail race. Ran over 4 miles to the start, hopped in the next race corral, ran Bay to Breakers with the colorfully costumed crowd, picked up my medal, ate a banana, ran back through Golden Gate Park, and then a bit more up city hills to round out 18 miles and 1000'.
#2023_141 #SanFrancisco #runner
2022: https://tantek.com/2022/138/t1/ran-baytobreakers
